availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathan G. Darnall (Bourbon County, Kentucky, grocer, postmaster, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, grocer, postmaster, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married Ann Arnold Darnall in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1826. Married to Elizabeth Darnall. Father of Louisa C. Darnall. Appointed postmaster for North Middleton, Bourbon County, on December 13, 1836. Grocer in Bourbon County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Appointed justice of the peace in Bourbon County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 305B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 525.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000183085, p. 181.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Bourbon County, Kentucky, vol. 12A.
KYR-0001-017-0177.
